intro: Stellarioides longibracteata, commonly known as the long-bract starwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant has slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Native to regions of North America, it thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological studies and ornamental gardening.
